ss_utilities.error_stats¶

Common error stat calculations.

Jamie Taylor 2018-09-04

ss_utilities.error_stats.mbe(predictions, actuals)¶

Calculate the Mean Bias Error (MBE).

Parameters
`predictions`numpy array of floats

Predictions being tested.

`actuals`numpy array of floats

Actual values corresponding to predictions. Must be same size as predictions.

Returns
float

MBE.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{gathered} y=Actuals,\quad f=Predictions\\ \mathit{MBE}=\frac{\sum_i^n{\left (f_i-y_i \right )}}{n} \end{gathered}\end{split}\]
ss_utilities.error_stats.pearson_coefficient(predictions, actuals)¶

Calculate the Pearson correlation coefficient [1].

Parameters
`predictions`numpy array of floats

Predictions being tested.

`actuals`: numpy array of floats

Actual values corresponding to predictions. Must be same size as predictions.

Returns
float

Pearson correlation coefficient.

Notes

\[\begin{align*} \rho_{x,y}=\frac{\mathrm{cov}(x, y)}{\sigma_x\sigma_y} \end{align*}\]

References

1

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pearson_correlation_coefficient

ss_utilities.error_stats.r_squared(predictions, actuals)¶

Calculate the coefficient of determination (a.k.a R-Squared) [1].

Parameters
`predictions`numpy array of floats

Predictions being tested.

`actuals`: numpy array of floats

Actual values corresponding to predictions. Must be same size as predictions.

Returns
float

Coefficient of determination.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{align*} y=Actuals,\quad f&=Predictions,\quad \bar{y}=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n{y_i}\\ SS_{tot}&=\sum_i{(y_i-\bar{y})^2}\\ SS_{res}&=\sum_i{(y_i-f_i)^2}\\ R^2&=1-\frac{SS_{res}}{SS_{tot}} \end{align*}\end{split}\]

References

1

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coefficient_of_determination

ss_utilities.error_stats.rmse(predictions, actuals)¶

Calculate the Root Mean Square Error (RMSE).

Parameters
`predictions`numpy array of floats

Predictions being tested.

`actuals`numpy array of floats

Actual values corresponding to predictions. Must be same size as predictions.

Returns
float

RMSE.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{gathered} y=Actuals,\quad f=Predictions\\ \mathit{RMSE}=\sqrt{\frac{\sum_i^n{{\left (f_i-y_i \right )}^2}}{n}} \end{gathered}\end{split}\]
ss_utilities.error_stats.wmape(predictions, actuals, norms=None, weights=None)¶

Calculate the weighted Mean Absolute Percent Error (MAPE).

Parameters
`predictions`numpy array of floats

Predictions being tested.

`actuals`numpy array of floats

Actual values corresponding to predictions. Must be same size as predictions.

`norms`numpy array of floats

Normalisation values. Must be same size as predictions. Default is to use actuals.

`weights`numpy array of floats

Weighting values. Must be same size as predictions. Default is to use actuals.

Returns
float

wMAPE.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{gathered} y=Actuals,\quad f=Predictions,\quad n=Normalisations,\quad w=Weights\\ \mathit{wMAPE}= \frac{\sum_i{w_i\times\mathrm{abs}\left(\frac{f_i-y_i}{n_i}\right)\times100\%}}{\sum_i{w_i}} \end{gathered}\end{split}\]
ss_utilities.error_stats.wmnbe(predictions, actuals, norms=None, weights=None)¶

Calculate the weighted Mean Normalised Bias Error (wMnBE).

Parameters
`predictions`numpy array of floats

Predictions being tested.

`actuals`numpy array of floats

Actual values corresponding to predictions. Must be same size as predictions.

`norms`numpy array of floats

Normalisation values. Must be same size as predictions. Default is to use actuals.

`weights`numpy array of floats

Weighting values. Must be same size as predictions. Default is to use actuals.

Returns
float

wMnBE.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{gathered} y=Actuals,\quad f=Predictions,\quad n=Normalisations,\quad w=Weights\\ \mathit{wMnBE}= \frac{\sum_i{w_i\times\frac{f_i-y_i}{n_i}\times100\%}}{\sum_i{w_i}} \end{gathered}\end{split}\]

ss_utilities.generic_tools¶

A module of generic, reusable tools.

  • Jamie Taylor <jamie.taylor@sheffield.ac.uk>

  • First Authored: 2015-01-16

class ss_utilities.generic_tools.GenericErrorLogger(filename)¶

Bases: object

Basic error logging to a file (optional).

Methods

write_to_log(msg)

Log the error message to the logfile along with a datestamp and the name of the script (in case of shared logfiles).

Log the error message to the logfile along with a datestamp and the name of the script (in case of shared logfiles).

ss_utilities.generic_tools.from_unixtime(unixtime_, timezone_='UTC')¶

DEPRECATED! Use https://github.com/SheffieldSolar/sp2ts instead. Convert a unixtime int, unixtime_, into python datetime object

Parameters
`unixtime_`int

Unixtime i.e. seconds since epoch

`timezone_`string

The timezone of the output date from Olson timezone database. Defaults to utc.

Returns
——-
datetime.datetime

Python datetime object (timezone aware)

Notes
—–
unixtime == seconds since epoch (Jan 01 1970 00:00:00 UTC)
Unit test: UKPVLiveTestCase.test_to_unixtime
ss_utilities.generic_tools.haversine_np(lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2, units='km')¶

Calculate the great circle distance between two points on the earth (specified in decimal degrees) All args must be of equal length! All input lat/lon are assumed to be decimal degrees!

Parameters
`lat1`np.array

Latitudes of reference point(s) as either Numpy array of dtype float or single float.

`lon1`np.array

Longitudes of reference point(s) as either Numpy array of dtype float or single float.

`lat2`np.array

Latitudes of point(s) of interest as either Numpy array of dtype float or single float.

`lon2`np.array

Longitudes of point(s) of interest as either Numpy array of dtype float or single float.

`units`str

One of: ‘km’ (default), ‘m’, ‘mi’.

ss_utilities.generic_tools.monthdelta(dt, delta)¶

Add or subtract delta months from the datetime dt.

ss_utilities.generic_tools.myround(number, base=5)¶

Round to the nearest base.

ss_utilities.generic_tools.print_progress(iteration, total, prefix='', suffix='', decimals=2, bar_length=100)¶

Call in a loop to create terminal progress bar.

Parameters
`iteration`int

current iteration (required)

`total`int

total iterations (required)

`prefix`string

prefix string (optional)

`suffix`string

suffix string (optional)

`decimals`int

number of decimals in percent complete (optional)

`bar_length`int

character length of bar (optional)

Notes
—–
Taken from `Stack Overflow <http://stackoverflow.com/a/34325723>`_.
ss_utilities.generic_tools.query_yes_no(question, default='yes')¶

Ask a yes/no question via raw_input() and return the answer as boolean.

Parameters
`question`string

The question presented to the user.

`default`string

The presumed answer if the user just hits <Enter>. It must be “yes” (the default), “no” or None (meaning an answer is required of the user).

Returns
——-
boolean

Return value is True for “yes” or False for “no”.

Notes
—–
See http://stackoverflow.com/a/3041990
ss_utilities.generic_tools.to_unixtime(datetime_, timezone_=None)¶

DEPRECATED! Use https://github.com/SheffieldSolar/sp2ts instead. Convert a python datetime object, datetime_, into unixtime int

Parameters
`datetime_`datetime.datetime

Datetime to be converted

`timezone_`string

The timezone of the input date from Olson timezone database. If datetime_ is timezone aware then this can be ignored.

Returns
——-
float

Unixtime i.e. seconds since epoch

Notes
—–
unixtime == seconds since epoch (Jan 01 1970 00:00:00 UTC)

See also

UKPVLiveTestCase.test_to_unixtime()
